ECB publishes final list of significant credit institutions http://t.co/JQLOwSugWt
ECB staff macroeconomic projections for the euro area http://t.co/y8ZZhIVWIW
Draghi: We have to say things as they are
Draghi: Growth friendlier composition of fiscal policy necessary
Draghi: Structural reforms, fiscal policy and monetary policy can jointly support growth
Draghi: ABS purchased should contain loans to the real economy
Draghi: ABS programme can strengthen the TLTRO
Draghi: Rules have been followed when hiring consultant for ABS programme
Draghi: There was a comfortable majority in favour of the programme
Draghi: ABS should be used to extend credit to the economy
Draghi: Some governors were in favour of doing more, some were in favour of doing less
Draghi: QE was discussed
Draghi: Difficult to quantify effect on the balance sheet at this stage
Draghi: Decision was not unanimous
Draghi: Rates at the lower bound now
Introductory statement Mario Draghi to the press conference http://t.co/qMWVRbKCYj
Draghi: There is also leeway to achieve a more growth-friendly composition of fiscal policies
Draghi: Existing SGP flexibility allows budgetary costs of major structural reforms to be addressed and demand to be supported
Draghi: Euro area countries should not unravel the progress made with fiscal consolidation and should proceed in line with the SGP
Draghi: Structural reforms now clearly need to gain momentum to achieve higher sustainable growth and employment in the euro area
Draghi: Compared to June 2014, projection for inflation for 2014 revised downwards. Projections for 2015 and 2016 have remained unchanged.
Draghi: The Governing Council sees the risks surrounding the economic outlook for the euro area on the downside
Draghi: Compared to June 2014, projections for real GDP growth for 2014 and 2015 revised downwards and for 2016 revised upwards
Draghi: If necessary, the Governing Council is unanimous in its commitment to using additional unconventional instruments within its mandate
Draghi: The newly decided measures, together with the TLTROs, will have a sizeable impact on our balance sheet
Draghi: The Eurosystem will also purchase a broad portfolio of euro-denominated covered bonds issued by euro area MFIs
Draghi: Underlying assets should consist of claims against the euro area non-financial private sector
Draghi: The Eurosystem will purchase a broad portfolio of simple and transparent asset-backed securities (ABSs)
Monetary policy decisions: rates cut by 10 basis points http://t.co/PPgYaMPMsV

Job alert: Two Press Officers – Communications and Language Services http://t.co/8qZxGf02R0
Job alert: Auditor – Internal Audit http://t.co/FE2bHOwEKU
Draghi: Would be useful to have a discussion on the overall fiscal stance of the euro area - including at EU level.
Draghi: Would be helpful if fiscal policy could play a greater role alongside monetary policy and there are various ways to achieve this
Draghi: The ECB will use all means within its mandate to ensure price stability over medium term
Draghi: Most effects are temporary but persistent low inflation could be a price stability risk.
Draghi: Measures announced by the ECB should provide the intended boost to demand and we stand ready to adjust our policy stance further
Draghi: On the demand side monetary policy can and should play a central role
Draghi: Structural policies needed for higher potential growth and to let fiscal and monetary policy regain traction on the economic cycle
Draghi: Aggregate demand policies will ultimately not be effective without action on the supply side
Draghi: We need action on both sides of the economy - aggregate demand policies have to be accompanied by national structural policies
Draghi: Job losses due to sovereign debt crisis mainly in countries affected by financial stress
The view from #JacksonHole Lodge where Mario Draghi is about to speak (prepared comments here http://t.co/iLmPIB6H6e) http://t.co/tTc5v11N1z
